ygData.subject: RE: [gladiator] Understanding Slime
ygData.msgSnippet: After splitting, they are both the same as the host.  (stat wise and game mechanics wise, and theoretically.)  Studied mitosis :) ? Like in the first slime

After splitting, they are both the same as the host.  (stat wise and game
mechanics wise, and theoretically.)  Studied mitosis :) ?

Like in the first slime battle in the original campaign, if gurgle splits,
either half of gurgle that you kill first announces ENEMY DEATH GURGLE
KILLED.

-----Original Message-----
From: Daniel Paul Hightower [mailto:alternate_dph@...]
Sent: Sunday, December 14, 2003 7:38 AM
To: gladiator@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [gladiator] Understanding Slime

I'm trying to do a pyschology analysis of the behavior of slime in the game
Gladiator.  Just Joking.

Really, I'ld like to know at what point after multiplying, does a slime
called "whatever" because a slime with no name?
